issue.title: Fix debbuild and bottle creation priority

message.raw:
This is the list of current priorities (lower are first):

```
_configs_/OSRFLinuxPerformance.groovy:        priority 300
_configs_/GenericCompilation.groovy:          priority 100
_configs_/OSRFLinuxABI.groovy:        priority 100
_configs_/OSRFLinuxInstall.groovy:        priority 300
_configs_/OSRFLinuxBuildPkg.groovy:        priority 300
```

I agree that for example Install jobs (those testing the installation of packages) can be the latest ones. Performance testing can also be one the lowest. So we have: BuildPkgs, Install and ABI. Should I assume that we want BuildPkgs first and Compilation+ABI after the pkgs building?

Homebrew bottles are usually not so affected by the traffic but I can setup the same priority than BuildPkgs without any problem.
message.html:
This is the list of current priorities (lower are first):

_configs_/OSRFLinuxPerformance.groovy:        priority 300
_configs_/GenericCompilation.groovy:          priority 100
_configs_/OSRFLinuxABI.groovy:        priority 100
_configs_/OSRFLinuxInstall.groovy:        priority 300
_configs_/OSRFLinuxBuildPkg.groovy:        priority 300

I agree that for example Install jobs (those testing the installation of packages) can be the latest ones. Performance testing can also be one the lowest. So we have: BuildPkgs, Install and ABI. Should I assume that we want BuildPkgs first and Compilation+ABI after the pkgs building?

Homebrew bottles are usually not so affected by the traffic but I can setup the same priority than BuildPkgs without any problem.
